item.title: That Sinking Feeling: The Politics of Sea Level Rise and Miami's Building Boom
item.description:
That Sinking Feeling: The Politics of Sea Level Rise and Miami's Building Boom

This article appears in the Winter 2016 issue of The American Prospect magazine. Subscribe here. Even from thousands of feet in the air, it's obvious that Miami is disturbingly low-lying. Luxury sky-high buildings, bridges, and cranes tower over swampy marshlands and the slowly rising sea.

item.title: Rising Seas: Inching Towards Disaster
item.description:
Rising Seas: Inching Towards Disaster

When will this affect the price of your house? It depends on where you live, of course, but aside from that, a lot depends on how fast sea level rises and how effectively new drainage systems and other engineering measures can fight it.
